name: Desktop Support
description: Careers in desktop support are ubiquitous--most companies need some form of tech support. As an IT Support Special, your job duties will include things like troubleshooting user issues and helping with system upgrades. Explore the training options for this type of career below.

trainings.title: 1 course - Technical Support Fundamentals by Google
Google IT Support Professional Certificate
trainings.jobTitlesAvailable: Desktop Support, IT Support, Junior System Administrator

name: IT Network Engineering
description: An IT network engineer designs the computer networks that organizations rely on to access, share, and store information. The complexity of the work depends on the organization: a small start up may employ a computer engineer to oversee a handful of desktop computers, while an engineer at a large multinational manages a web of complex, globally distributed networks. Check out the resources below!

trainings.title: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
trainings.length: 27 videos, flashcards, and interactive labs - Approx. 2-6 months (recommended)

name: Web Developer
description: There are a lot of possible careers in development. For more information on the training available for these, check below!

paths.path: JavaScript Algorithms and Data Structures Certification

paths.jobTitlesAvailable: Front End Developer, Front End Engineer, Front End Software Engineer
Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Visualization Developer
Node JS Developer, Node API Developer, Node JS Software Developer

paths.path: Information Security and Quality Assurance Certifications
